comment.body: I made a 'followers' button on Infinity, i just haven't done the panel list yet. (i'm trying to add image posting)

Vincent (@up4) made a working prototype, but nofish thought it should be plugin than core feature, with suggestion of a future 'app-store' type feature (similar to Sandstorm.io by the sounds of it) allowing users to easily plug in additional features, thus keeping ZN's core stable/small)

  https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/521

The first things we make take a lot of time and effort with small reward. I cloned Flappy Bird and took a week to upgrade it. Then a week to clone Nullpaste and add an editor. Then perhaps a month making a more modular app frontend. But the new frontend let's me take github content and launch it with add-on features in a few days. Starting with existing open source and building from there reduces dev time enormously. Provide the original sources and people can see what you've added. As @Shellbound says, the next step is collaboration on ZN apps to speed the process even more.
